Reviews.Title: Casio Exilim Rulez
Reviews.Author: Maciej Szumny
Reviews.Content: This is my second Casio Exilim camera. Second, because with my first one I went to the ocean and it didn't survive. Thanks God I still have all the great pictures it took.I remember when I purchased my first Exilim, my friends were making jokes that I'm buying a watch, not a camera. But in my opinion Casio makes much better cameras than Canon or Nikon (these are the brands I can compare to). The picture quality is great, the colors are FANTASTIC - nothing needs to be improved by PhotoShop ;)My new EX-S8 already took some amazing pictures, it's nice, light, slim and unexpensive. For me - not being a professional photographer - the Casio Exilim is absolutely awesome.

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera but battery is not as good
Reviews.Author: photobugz
Reviews.Content: We decided to get a second camera.  Since we love our Casio Z1000 so much, another Casio was our first choice.  This little camera has all the features and then some, campared to the Z1000.  If you want a point and shoot that's easy to use and handle, at an affordable price, then this is the camera for you.The only cons have to do with the battery.  It's a dismal 700mAh compared to the 1300mAh for the Z1000.  That means the battery life is about 1/2... 1/2 the pics and twice charging.To make it worse, the battery has to be removed from the camara and placed into a cradle to recharge.  It can't be 'plugged and charged' like other cameras and devices.  Of course it's not difficult to do, but would you buy a cell phone if you had to remove the battery every time you wanted to charge?  Probably not.The camera is nice; however, the battery issues make us want to look for a different brand camera.

Reviews.Title: All Good But One
Reviews.Author: Naz
Reviews.Content: The camera overall is pretty small, i still think it would have been a little nicer if it was thinner but manageable. The screen is more than adequate, the pictures are pretty decent also, in low ligth enviroments you have to tinker with the settings to get better shots. The only reall problem i have with this camera is the optical zoom which is pretty short. This i a major issue with compact digital cameras. Battery life is decent as well, and the flash is plenty bright. The video recorder is very good as it records in 480-- which is dvd quality and it records as much as the memory stick can hold, which is a featuer i love. All in all for a camera under a hundred bucks i think its pretty well rounded and i definately think you should give it a spin.Naz..

Reviews.Title: Love My Camera
Reviews.Author: apoem "apoem"
Reviews.Content: I would strongly suggest this to someone else as a great camera to buy. I have managed to put it through it's paces a little bit trying to take photos at night, of fireworks, in low lighting and inside and outside and of kids etc.First the ProsThis is a very slim camera with a large screen on the back. I like the large screen.I particularly like that the buttons are somewhat flat or recessed so it is difficult to turn this camera by accident or to snag buttons while you are using it.This is a fairly easy to use camera. If you are looking for a specific situation you can push a button called bs (For best shot) and come up with a series of scenarios you can use to take a good picture (for example, kids, fireworks, flowers etc). I have used several of these and each one has helped me to take better photos. I have used fireworks and have made some lovely fire work photos. They are far from professional or even a hobbyist level but they look good to the casual person. Similarly the one option for children, flowers, and food.The videos are easy to take and they have a good play back quality.Overall, this camera is one I would buy again should something happen to this one. This is an easy to use, intuitive camera.The ConsThe problems I have had with this camera or some of the concerns that you might want to look at before buying.This camera does not have a view finder. To add the little visual view finder you either add quite a bit more money or more weight and in some instances both. This was not near as important to me as it would be to other people. Second, I have not had this problem and I've been using this for several weeks now but there might be some concern about being able to use the screen view finder in high light levels outside as it makes it hard to see the screen.When you are using the bs and if you don't use the camera for a few minutes (such as waiting for fireworks to start again) and if the camera goes off, when you want to take your next shot you will have to go through the whole bs process again in order to take photos. It doesn't take much time to touch bs and scroll through the options and click on the one you want. However, should you be trying to capture something fast moving (fireworks for instance) then there is a possibility you will miss it.There are other cameras out there that are bigger with more options. I like some of the cannons with the swiveling screen and used the swiveling screen way more than I thought I would. However, for something easy to carry, light weight, high speed, with enough options that you won't miss the ones you don't have- this is an excellent camera. I love mine.Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Comparable to higher priced brands
Reviews.Author: Brandon Hand
Reviews.Content: I researched this camera for about a week before I purchased it. It was similarly spec'ed to higher priced Nikons and Canons. After reading every review I could find, and comparing every spec listed, I decided it was worth it.Now, after having it for a few months, I can say without a doubt, it is a great purchase.It is very reliable and with the Class 10 SDHC card I also purchased for it, incredibly fast. The facial recognition works wonderfully and the image stabilization is very noticeable in the videos I've recorded. I keep this in my pocket wherever I go because it's slim and easy to carry around, and I want to be ready for that crazy thing that no one will believe happened.If you're on the fence about spending over $100 on a point and shoot, I highly suggest this camera. For $20 less, you can get the same features and quality, minus the famous brand tax.

Reviews.Title: Casio doesn't disappoint
Reviews.Author: Boop
Reviews.Content: I already had a Casio and although it was out-dated, I loved the ease of using it.  It was small, light-weight, and took abuse.  It lasted me about five years and three trips to Italy.  Finally, when the lens wouldn't extend I decided I needed another camera.  Originally, I wanted something with more fun features but decided to get another Exilim so I would have less of a learning curve and I'm glad I did.  I ordered it and had it sent directly to Arizona where I was visiting family for the holidays and was able to open the box and start taking pictures!  No stress.  The only surprise was that a "black" camera meant it was plastic.  I thought it was a 'color' choice when choosing between that and silver.  My original one was silver, therefore metal.  If I had known, I would have gotten silver and paid the extra 10bucks.  Happy New Year!

Reviews.Title: Just what I hoped it would be
Reviews.Author: Hottubber
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a replacement for an older 10mp version I was a little rough on.I realy like the fact that I can shoot in High Res. for the family and kids pics and easily switch to lower res. product images for my business and email needs.

Reviews.Title: A replacement
Reviews.Author: J. Weiss "bookd"
Reviews.Content: This was to upgrade and replace the cheapo digita cameras for walmart for my girls aged 11 an 13.  this camera is a nice point and shoot with lots of options.  Upgrade the memory card and you will never run out of space if you downloard once or twice a year.  My sister ended up using the one I sent to my niece and has been happy with her pictures as well.  I use the bigger and older My daughters cameras did not fare well- sant in the zoom and little brother destroyed both within a year- round 2 in black has had better results this year- Know your kids if they trash stuff these may not be a good choice- if they can respect it is a camera not a frisbee they it is a good choice.  Also nice for thr point a shoot adult who just wants to take some vaca pics to brag about or moms 65 birthday party.  Good prints on the higher res settings and easy to use.Well worth the money have bought this line severltimes the last 8 years or so as they improve technology.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: NordiaB
Reviews.Content: I love the picture quality, I have been a casio faithful for quite a few years. My only displeasure is that the picture quality on the camera does not match the uploaded quality. The picture quality actually looks way better in camera view than the printed quality.

Reviews.Title: No need for manual
Reviews.Author: Janos Gereben
Reviews.Content: The first among a number of digital cameras I have tried, Exilim S8 was easy to figure out. I was able to use just about every feature just by going around the menu or using such handy single controls as a red button for video.It's not the the thinnest of its kind - a minor drawback, a more serious problem (depriving it of the fifth star) is that even setting it on the highest ISO and using flash (another control easy to figure out), indoor shots are dark.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing optics
Reviews.Author: Pantagruel "Pantagruel"
Reviews.Content: This is an attractive product in terms of features and ease of use, but I found the image quality to be not very good.  It may be a defect of the particular camera I bought, but the photos lacked contrast and 'crispness'.  They seemed washed out.  A blow-up of a small part of the picture showed why.  Compared to a blow-up of the same photo but taken with my similarly priced Olympus, the image had a 'water-colour' fuzzines to it. Very few of the small details were shown in the Casio photo while they were very clear in the Olympus.  Again, this may be caused by a malfunction of the camera I bought.If the other nice features and price of this camera fit your needs, try it out and compare the results to those of your present camera.  You may have different results than mine.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: Kimberly
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my daughter for her birthday.  She is absolutely in LOVE with it.  She takes it everywhere and especially loves the video feature.  The buttons are a small, but they are fine for her little fingers.  I recommend buying an extra battery so that changes are quick and easy.  But I am so pleased with not having to deal with AAs any more.  I felt like I was always wasting them.  The regular AAs never worked well so I had to buy special ones to get any kind of battery life.  And the rechargables didn't hold charge for very long.  The only problem with this camera is that it is so small, you have to be careful not to lose it!

Reviews.Title: Purchased as gift
Reviews.Author: Kenneth W. Ross Moberg "Mountain Man"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for my son. He is MR and has found this camera to be user friendly as well as takes good pictures. He has learned to use the presets and is happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Use your phone's camera instead.
Reviews.Author: Roby1227
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the price.I was disappointed with the performance to say the least.For decent pictures the person taking the picture needs to have very steady hands.Action photos are terrible (very grainy).Overall, your better off using the camera built into your phone.

Reviews.Title: I like it.
Reviews.Author: Nathan C. Sharpless
Reviews.Content: I'm rough with cameras, which is why I buy cheapo's, and this one takes a small beating. I can make one of these last about 3 years.  This is my 3rd.  I carry it everyday and everywhere.  If you use a camera only on special occasions it should last forever.  I like it.  I actually sell pictures I take with it, and I'm not too upset when I break one because they're cheap.

Reviews.Title: Casio rocks
Reviews.Author: Ken M.
Reviews.Content: Purchased this unit used after I lost a much older unit.  It is fantastic, fast, feature rich and takes excellent photos

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Ana M. Medina "Ana"
Reviews.Content: I've had other versions of this model before and for 12 MP there is still a need to buy a separate camera rather than just relying on a smartphone for taking good pictures.  The vendor I bought this from was also great.  Thanks!

Reviews.Title: happy with purchse.
Reviews.Author: max assurance
Reviews.Content: Glad to have found this so cheap and in such good condition. It smelled like smoke a little so please don't smoke and take pictures.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: hisako  edejer
Reviews.Content: Just easy to use everybody.I love this camera.  This camera recognize faces. I don't know how long is battery last ,Because I just got last month. (so far it's ok)

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Jenni
Reviews.Content: It takes great pictures. sometimes I notice I do have to retake a picture if I am trying to take a close up of something. But over all takes very good pictures

Reviews.Title: Love the pictures
Reviews.Author: Pam Hickey
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. This is my second as I misplaced my first. Was delivered quickly and works great. Will get another, for sure.

Reviews.Title: Best camera i've ever owned
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: I love the Casio Exilim digital cameras.  This is actually my second one.  My first one made it though my partying days & being dropped & took my son to disney land & somehow the ink in the screen burst & well it still took pictures I just couldn't see what I was taking pictures of through the screen.  Thank goodness for my cellphone I was able to still capture memories.  This camera is amazing when it gets used now that I have my iphone lol, only really gets used on vacations but I love it!!!  Very clear pictures.

Reviews.Title: camara exilim ex-s8 12 mp
Reviews.Author: yanitzet patiño
Reviews.Content: me enviaron a Venezuela la cámara como nueva y sin rayones, excelente en todas sus funciones, buena bonita y barata, vendedor 100% Recomendado.

Reviews.Title: A Better Camera
Reviews.Author: Lane N Copley
Reviews.Content: My Casio Exilim EX-S8 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Blue) has been taking pictures for me for a whole year now, after Christmas of last year when we got them on special sale at Radio Shack (of all places.  It was $70 for a bundle which included a picture frame which we don't use but Grandma does.  We got four of them).  The SX-80 is small, lightweight and has a huge capacity for storage (hours of HD video and thousands of pictures at 12 megapixel resolution in those lovely SanDisk 8GB SD cards).  As you can see from this year's pictures, I love it to bits and recommend it for everyone's general use.  It's still a point-and-shoot, but it has all the latest electronic goodies (except image stabilization), a nice large format, a relatively intuitive interface (considering the complexity of the product and how little time people will devote to learning it, yeah) and a small form factor.  The UI has an easy mode and a hellish mode (hard to learn, detailed and difficult, just like film photography).I recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: G. Mitchell
Reviews.Content: I borrowed my ex-husbands Casio so I knew I wanted this brand. I was able to load it up and use it right away. I love the ease and the great pictures it takes. Plus it is light weight and slender, but with a big enough screen so you don't have to squint to see it. Only downfall is that the battery pack is not in a dock system. However the battery lasts forever so I don't have to charge it much. I am really happy with it and thinking about getting more for gifts.

Reviews.Title: Nice looking, performance is okay
Reviews.Author: Isalasoo
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for 5 months.Pros: Sleek design; big LCD screen on the back; a designated button for taking video (don't need to take the time to go through a menu on the camera); lots of 'Best Shot' choices (portrait, scenery, party, nightscene, for ebay, etc).Cons: I wish it had a better zoom; it takes a while for it to focus/take the shot which means there are quick events that I won't be able to capture; quality of the photos is a little grainy- they don't look sharp on Facebook, I haven't gotten physical copies of any of my photos so I don't know what the quality is like in that medium.I bought this mostly because of it's price, I wish I had spent a little more for a camera that will give me better quality shots. It's easy to use; I need to play more with the menu options and see what combo of setting can make the quality better. Would I repurchase? No. Would I return it right away? Eh, I'm fine with it for now. When it's time for a new camera I'll put more time into researching other options.

Reviews.Title: Sexy little camera
Reviews.Author: Earth Goddess "Born Rebel"
Reviews.Content: I was just in the market for a new camera something smaller then the one I currently use and not as heavy. I happen to come across this little baby at target on clearance for only $48.58(55% off with using my target card)!!! My limit was exactly $50.00!! So I knew this was the one to join our family. I love it so far! I dont purchase items I dont fall in love with at first sight! This one here is a keeper!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Impressive
Reviews.Author: Richard I
Reviews.Content: Impressive, simple start up and operation with many features. I purchased 2 Casio EX-S8 cameras for family members. It comes with an international warranty.Casio Exilim EX-S8 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)

Reviews.Title: Good Quality for this price!!!
Reviews.Author: chelsea
Reviews.Content: I believe it is the best quality you can get for this price. Nice colors, light weight, and cute pics! I recommend it

Reviews.Title: Casio digital camera
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: This was given as a gift. Recipient says it takes great pictures, easy to carry, absolutely loves it and is very pleased

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY FROM THIS COMPANY
Reviews.Author: Frances Spillman
Reviews.Content: I PURCHASED THIS CAMERA JANUARY 13, 2011 THROUGH AMAZON AND RECEIVED IT.  WHEN I CHECKED THE ITEMS THAT WERE SUPPOSED TO BE IN THE BOX---NO LITHIUM BATTERY.  I CONTACTED THE COMPANY AND WAS GIVEN A NUMBER TO WHICH I WAS TO FAX THE INVOICE AND AN EXPLANATION OF THE PROBLEM.  THREE WEEKS LATER I CHECKED WITH PARTS DEPT. AND THEY CLAIMED I SENT TO WRONG NUMBER.  THE WOMAN SAID SHE WOULD GET THE PAPERWORK FROM THE OTHER DEPT.  I LATER CHECKED AND THEY CLAIMED THEY WERE OUT OF THE BATTERIES AND IT WOULD BE 2 TO 3 WEEKS BEFORE THEY WOULD HAVE ANY.  IF YOU WANT TO "USE" A CAMERA, DO NOT BUY A CASIO.  MY HUSBAND HAD ONE BEFORE THAT NEEDED REPAIR--WAS GOING TO COST MORE TO REPAIR THAN A NEW ONE.  TRY ANOTHER BRAND!

Reviews.Title: No memory ! !
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: So, who would sell a digital camera without a memory card?Yes, it clearly is a buyer beware program with this seller.I consider myself to be slightly brighter than the average bear, but of a half dozen or more digital cameras I've bought over the years, this is the first one to have the memory chip stripped out.

ProductInfo.Features:
Lens Focal Length - f=6.3 - 18.9mm Approx. 27 - 108mm equivalent to 35mm film / 4X digital zoom (16 times both with optical and digital zoom)
Contrast Detection Auto Focus
Focus Mode - Auto Focus, Macro Mode, Pan Focus, Infinity Mode, And Manual Focus
AF Area - Intelligent, Spot, Multi, Tracking
Focus Range - Auto focus - Approx. 3.11 - Infinity (W); Macro - Approx. 3.11 - 1.64' (W)
ProductInfo.Name: Casio Exilim EX-S8 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
